intro: Lycium chanar, commonly known as Indian wolfberry, is a shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshade plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow-orange berries that are rich in antioxidants. Lycium chanar typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
